thread.title: Jordan Henderson admits Liverpool must not let fine start "go to waste" after woeful run of form
thread.title_full: Jordan Henderson admits Liverpool must not let fine start "go to waste" after woeful run of form

author: Liam Prenderville
title: Jordan Henderson admits Liverpool must not let fine start "go to waste" after woeful run of form
text:
Sport Jordan Henderson admits Liverpool must not let fine start "go to waste" after woeful run of form Jurgen Klopp's men have won just one of their 10 matches since the turn of the year and are now 13 points adrift of Chelsea Share Henderson in action during training (Photo: John Powell) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Liverpool skipper Jordan Henderson has admitted the Reds are in danger of letting their fine start to the season go to waste. 
Jurgen Klopp's men are on a run of just one win from 10 matches since the turn of the year and that came in the FA Cup replay against Plymouth. 
Liverpool went into 2017 in second in the Premier League but are now fifth, 13 points adrift of Chelsea, and have been dumped out of both cups. 
Saturday's visit of Tottenham is now a huge game for the Reds and Henderson accepts they must arrest the slide immediately. 
"January wasn’t what any of us had hoped for and it certainly wasn’t what any of us expected, from ourselves as individuals or the team," he writes in the matchday programme. The Reds skipper reacts during the defeat to Hull (Photo: Liverpool FC via Getty) Henderson shows appreciation to the Liverpool fans (Photo: Nigel Roddis) 
"Everyone at the club, from players through to all the staff, have worked extremely hard up until now and it’s vital we don’t let all that hard work go to waste because of a difficult January. 
“It’s on us to ensure it was a ‘bad month’ and not a bad season." 
Klopp's men lost just one of their first 13 matches this term to put themselves into the title picture. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
